{{also|Europą|Európa|Euròpa|Eùropa|eŭropa|Eurōpa|Eŭropa}} ==English== {{wikipedia}} {{wikipedia|52 Europa}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|en|grc|Εὐρώπη}}, a character name in Greek mythology. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|en|/jʊˈɹoʊpə/}} * {{audio|en|En-Europa.ogg|Audio}} ===Proper noun=== [[File:Europa-moon.jpg|thumb|The moon [[Europa]]]] {{en-proper noun}} # {{lb|en|Greek mythology}} Several characters, most notably a [[Phoenician]] [[princess]] [[abduct|abducted]] to [[Crete]] by [[Zeus]]. # {{lb|en|astronomy}} A [[moon]] of [[Jupiter]]. # {{lb|en|astronomy}} {{w|52 Europa}}, a main belt [[asteroid]]; not to be confused with the [[Jovian]] moon. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|en|Europan}} * {{l|en|Europe}} * {{l|en|European}} ====Translations==== {{trans-top|princess abducted (mythologia)|mul=Europa|mullabel=Europa (continens)|lang=la}} [[File:Rape of Europa MAN Napoli Inv111475.jpg|thumb|'''Europa''' seated on a bull (Jupiter in disguise), in fresco from Pompeii, 1st century AD.]] [[File:Herodotus World Map.jpg|thumb|The world according to Herodotus showing '''Europa''' near the top of the map.]] ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|la|Eurōpē}} ===Etymology=== From {{der|en|grc|Εὐρώπη}}, of uncertain origin, but either from: *{{der|en|grc|εὐρύς}} + [[ὄψ]] (''óps''), literally meaning "wide face" (as a description of the beauty of the mythical [[w:Europa_(consort_of_Zeus)|Europa]]) or "broad eye" (metaphorically meaning something like "as far as the eye can see") *{{der|en|sem}} origin, such as: **{{cog|akk|erebu|𒌓𒋙|to set, occident, west}}, **{{cog|phn|𐤏‎𐤓‎𐤁‎|tr=ʿereb|t=evening}}. **{{cog|arc|ערובה|tr=ʿrōbā||sunset, Sabbath eve}}, **{{cog|he|ערבה|tr=ben‑aruboh|בֶּן‑עֲרֻבָּה|hostages}} and [[מַעֲרָב]] (''ma‑ārov'', "occident, west"), **{{cog|syc|ܥܪܘܒܐ|tr=aruba||hostages}} and [[ܡܥܪܒܐ]] (''ma‑arba'', "occident, west"), **{{cog|ar|غرب|tr=gharb|غَرْب|occident, west}}, ===Pronunciation=== * {{la-IPA|Eurōpa}} * {{audio|la|la-cls-Europa.ogg|Audio (Classical)}} ===Proper noun=== {{la-proper noun|Eurōpa<1.loc>}} # {{lb|la|mythology}} {{l|en|Europa}} {{gloss|daughter of Phoenician king {{l|en|Agenor}} who was abducted by {{l|en|Jupiter}} and carried to {{l|en|Crete}}}} # {{l|en|Europe}} #* '''43''', [[w:Pomponius Mela|Pomponius Mela]], ''De situ orbis'', book 1, chapter 3: #*: {{quote|la|Brevis '''Europae''' descriptio.—'''Europa''' terminos habet, ab oriente Tanain et Maeotida et Pontum; a meridie reliqua nostri maris; ab occidente Atlanticum; a septentrione Britannicum oceanum.|q=genetive and nomitive cases}} #* '''ca. 415''', [[w:Martianus Capella|Martianus Capella]], ''De nuptiis Philologiae et Mercurii'', book 6, section 661: #*: {{quote|la|Quartus vero et magnus '''Europae''' sinus ab Hellesponto incipiens Maeotis ostio terminatur. Nam arctum mare inter '''Europam''' et Asiam in angustias septem stadiorum interfluens coarctatur; quas angustias Hellespontum dicunt, ubi Xerxes Persidis rex aggregatis navibus ponteque constructo exercitum duxit.|q=genetive and accusative cases}} ====Declension==== {{la-ndecl|Eurōpa<1.loc>}} ====Derived terms==== {{top2}} * {{l|la|Eurōpaeus|t=of Europa, of Europe|pos=adjective}} * {{l|la|Eurōpēnsis|t=of Europe|pos=adjective}} {{bottom}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|bg|Европа|bor=1}} * {{desc|ca|Europa}} * {{desc|en|Europa|bor=1}}, {{l|en|Europe}} ** {{desc|ko|^유럽|bor=1}} * {{desc|nl|Europa|bor=1}} * {{desc|fr|Europe}} * {{desc|de|Europa|bor=1}} * {{desc|it|Europa}} * {{desc|cmn|歐羅巴|bor=1}} * {{desc|pt|Europa}} ** → Japanese: {{ja-r|ヨーロッパ|caps=y}} * {{desc|ro|Europa}} * {{desc|es|Europa}} * {{desc|ru|Европа|bor=1}} ===References=== * {{R:L&S}} * {{R:PersEnc}} * {{R:Peck}} * {{R:Smith's Persons}} * {{R:Smith's Geography}} [[Category:la:Continents]] [[Category:la:Europe]] ---- ==Lithuanian== {{wikipedia|lang=lt}} [[Image:LocationEurope.png|thumb|Europa]] ===Proper noun=== {{lt-proper noun|f}} #
